question: Name a Canadian heroine who warned James FitzGibbon of a planned American attack during the War of 1812.
main_question: Name a Canadian heroine who warned James FitzGibbon of a planned American attack during the War of 1812.
explanatory_sentence: In 1813, Laura Secord, pioneer wife and mother of five children, made a dangerous 19-mile (30-km) journey on foot to warn Lieutenant James FitzGibbon of a planned American attack. Her bravery contributed to victory at the Battle of Beaver Dams. She is recognized as a heroine to this day.
